SEARCH
Package gw.api.print

Class ListViewPrintOptionPopupAction

java.lang.Object
gw.api.print.PrintAction
gw.api.print.PrintLocationAction
gw.api.print.PrintWidgetAction
gw.api.print.ListViewPrintAction
gw.api.print.ListViewPrintOptionPopupAction
public final class ListViewPrintOptionPopupAction extends ListViewPrintAction
Variation of the the PrintAction which pops up print options for printing a ListView embedded in a panel on the present Location's Screen. Users can choose from several print options on this popup:

- print to PDF - output to CSV - output to CSV which selected columns (user selectable in this popup)

once the selection is made, the print processing is triggered.

The process of printing a list view with various different output options is done in two steps, each accomplished with a different but related List View print action. These are:

- ListViewPrintOptionPopupAction: prepares for printing by priming the popup dialog box which asks the user for print instructions. This action is responsible for examining the List View in question to find what columns are avaiable to print. It is also responsible for activation of the popup.

- ListViewCustomPrintAction: action triggered when a user clicks the "OK" button, which signifies that the user has made his/her choices and wishes to print. This action is responsible for examining the choices made by the user, then performing the actual print.

Author:
pyoung

      title - title caption to apply to list view
      settings - print settings to apply to the print

    • printWidget

      protected void printWidget(String widgetId, PrintSettings settings)
      Override of the standard PrintWidgetAction onAction() event trigger. Unfortunately, the way list view printing with options works does not fit well (actually at all) with the standard print action pattern. LV printing with options works likes this:

      - on the onAction() trigger, set things up and show the LV Print Options popup; set this to be the picker listener. - when the user has finished picking whatever options, clicking 'OK' triggers the onPick() event trigger. - the onPick sets things up and then performs the print job.

      Not only that, but to add to the fun, this list view printer actually prints more than just the widget, but the whole page. This is kludgy at best, but maybe later I'll fix this to make more sense (if I don't do this right now, the title bar and all the other stuff that goes along with the LV output we commonly want is missing) PY 2006/05/08

      Overrides:
      printWidget in class PrintWidgetAction
      Parameters:
      widgetId -
